XKRT
XKRT is a low-level tasking runtime system.

37 // Usage recommendation
38 //
39 // Implement a new structure on top of a khp-tree, lets say `toto-tree.hpp`
40 // In `toto-tree.hpp` , before including `khp-tree.hpp`, explicitely define
41 // all of these depending on your need:
42 // - KHP_TREE_REBALANCE
43 // - KHP_TREE_CUT_ON_INSERT
44 // - KHP_TREE_MAINTAIN_SIZE
45 // - KHP_TREE_MAINTAIN_HEIGHT
46 //
47 // See each variable definition in this file for details.
48 //
49 // If you are scare to break the data structure, or suspect a bug, you should
50 // set `KHP_TREE_ENABLE_COHERENCY_CHECKS`. It adds several coherency checks
51 // on each operations, but severely slowdowns the execution making most operations O(n^2).
52 
53 
54 // TODO PERFORMANCES IDEA
55 // - remove the use of 'virtual' to replace with template 'node' type and inlined functions
56 
57 #ifndef __KHP_TREE_H__
58 # define __KHP_TREE_H__
59 
60 // tree assert, must be called within a member function
61 # if KHP_TREE_ENABLE_COHERENCY_CHECKS
62 # pragma message("Unset `KHP_TREE_ENABLE_COHERENCY_CHECKS` for max performance")
63 # define tassert(expr) \
64  do { \
65  if (!(expr)) \
66  { \
67  this->export_pdf("khp-tree"); \
68  fprintf(stdout, "%s:%d: assertion `" #expr "` failed in `%s`\n", \
69  __FILE__,__LINE__,__func__); \
70  abort(); \
71  } \
72  } while (0)
73 # else /* NDEBUG */
74 # define tassert(ignore) ((void)0)
75 # endif /* NDEBUG */
76 
77 # include <cassert>
78 # include <cstdio>
79 # include <cstring>
80 # include <cstdlib>
81 # include <vector>
82 # include <climits>
83 
84 # include <functional>
85 using namespace std::placeholders;
86 
87 # include <type_traits>
88 
89 # include <ostream>
90 # include <iostream>
91 
92 # include <cstdint>
93 
94 static inline int
95 khp_log2(unsigned int n)
96 {
97  return 31 - __builtin_clz(n);
98 }
99 
100 static inline int
101 khp_twopow(int n)
102 {
103  return (1 << n);
104 }
105 
106 # include <xkrt/utils/min-max.h>
107 # include <xkrt/memory/access/common/hyperrect.hpp>
108 # include <xkrt/sync/direction.h>
109 
110 # define FOREACH_K_CHILD_BEGIN(N, C, I, D) \
111 do { \
112  for (int D = LEFT ; D < DIRECTION_MAX ; ++D) \
113  { \
114  Node * C = reinterpret_cast<Node *>(N->st[I].children[D]); \
115  if (C) \
116  {
117 # define FOREACH_K_CHILD_END(N, C, I, D) \
118  } \
119  } \
120 } while (0)
121 
122 # define FOREACH_CHILD_BEGIN(N, C, I, D) \
123 do { \
124  for (int I = 0 ; I < K ; ++I) \
125  { \
126  FOREACH_K_CHILD_BEGIN(N, C, I, D) \
127  {
128 # define FOREACH_CHILD_END(N, C, I, D) \
129  } \
130  FOREACH_K_CHILD_END(N, C, I, D); \
131  } \
132 } while (0)
133 
134 
135 typedef enum Color
136 {
137  BLACK = 0,
138  RED = 1
139 } Color;
140 
146 template<
147  int K,
148  typename T,
149  bool REBALANCE = false,
150  bool CUT_ON_INSERT = false,
151  bool MAINTAIN_SIZE = false,
152  bool MAINTAIN_HEIGHT = false
153 >
154 class KHPTree {
155 
156  // REBALANCE - Whether to automatically rebalance the tree. This only
157  // makes sense if cutting the tree. If this is set, you should also set
158  // `MAINTAIN_SIZE` and `MAINTAIN_HEIGHT` to avoid O(n) on each imbalance
159  // checks
160 
161  // CUT_ON_INSERT - to cut subtree nodes when inserting new nodes that
162  // passes the `should_cut` test
163 
164  // MAINTAIN_SIZE and MAINTAIN_HEIGHT - whether 'height' and 'size' should
165  // be computed lazily (i.e. O(n) on each call) or maintained after
166  // insertion/rotations
167 
168  // `CUT_ON_INSERT` is set but not `REBALANCE`
169  // it means the tree might get imbalanced if cutting occurs
170  static_assert(!CUT_ON_INSERT || (CUT_ON_INSERT && REBALANCE));
171 
172 
173  // `REBALANCE` is set but not `MAINTAIN_SIZE` and `MAINTAIN_HEIGHT`
174  // Set them too to avoid O(n) on each operation
175  static_assert(!REBALANCE || (REBALANCE && MAINTAIN_SIZE && MAINTAIN_HEIGHT));
176 
177  public:
178 
179  using Hyperrect = KHyperrect<K>;
180 
181  class Node {
182 
183  public:
184 
185  /* a node subtree */
186  typedef union
187  {
188  Node * children[2];
189  struct {
190  Node * left;
191  Node * right;
192  };
193  } subtree_t;
194 
195  /* node's parent */
196  Node * parent;
197 
198  /* node's color in each subtree */
199  Color colors[K];
200 
201  /* the rect represented by this node */
202  Hyperrect hyperrect;
203 
204  /* the dimension represented by this node */
205  int k;
206 
207  /* node's child */
208  subtree_t st[K];
209 
210  /* includes metadata */
211  template <bool S, bool H>
212  struct includes_t {};
213 
214  template<>
215  struct includes_t<true, true> {
216 
217  // subtree englobing rect
218  Hyperrect hyperrect;
219 
220  // subtree number of elements
221  int size[K];
222 
223  // subtree height
224  int height[K];
225  };
226 
227  template<>
228  struct includes_t<true, false> {
229  Hyperrect hyperrect;
230  int size[K];
231  };
232 
233  template<>
234  struct includes_t<false, true> {
235  Hyperrect hyperrect;
236  int height[K];
237  int total_height;
238  };
239 
240  template<>
241  struct includes_t<false, false> {
242  Hyperrect hyperrect;
243  };
244 
245  includes_t <MAINTAIN_SIZE, MAINTAIN_HEIGHT> includes;
246 
247  #if KHP_TREE_ENABLE_COHERENCY_CHECKS
248  struct {
249  int id;
250  } checks;
251  #endif /* KHP_TREE_ENABLE_COHERENCY_CHECKS */
252 
253  public:
254 
255  Node() :
256  parent(nullptr),
257  colors{BLACK}
258  {}
259 
260  Node(
261  const Hyperrect & h,
262  const int k,
263  const Color color
264  ) :
265  parent(nullptr),
266  colors{BLACK},
267  hyperrect(h),
268  k(k)
269  {
270  memset(this->st, 0, sizeof(this->st));
271 
272  this->includes.hyperrect.copy(h);
273 
274  if constexpr (MAINTAIN_SIZE)
275  {
276  memset(this->includes.size, 0, sizeof(this->includes.size));
277  this->includes.size[k] = 1;
278  }
279 
280  if constexpr (MAINTAIN_HEIGHT)
281  {
282  memset(this->includes.height, 0, sizeof(this->includes.height));
283  for (int i = k ; i < K ; ++i)
284  this->includes.height[i] = 1;
285  this->includes.total_height = 1;
286  }
287 
288  this->colors[k] = color;
289  }
290 
291  virtual ~Node() {}
292 
294  // Utilities //
296 
297  inline Node *
298  get_child(int k, Direction dir) const
299  {
300  return reinterpret_cast<Node *>(this->st[k].children[dir]);
301  }
302 
303  // size
304  // TODO : maintaining the size (n-k) per k-tree is a bothersome O(KÂ²)
305  // It is currently used to detecting imbalance on a k-subtree
306  //
307  // Another way would to be maintain the size (n) for the entire b-tree,
308  // and if load imbalance is detected - h >=2*K*log(n) - then compute
309  // the n-k's and rebalance where it needs
310  inline void
311  update_includes_size(void)
312  requires MAINTAIN_SIZE
313  {
314  for (int k = 0 ; k < K ; ++k)
315  this->includes.size[k] = 0;
316  this->includes.size[this->k] = 1;
317 
318  for (int k = this->k ; k < K ; ++k)
319  {
320  for (int kk = 0 ; kk < K ; ++kk)
321  {
322  int nl = this->st[kk].left ? this->st[kk].left->includes.size[k] : 0;
323  int nr = this->st[kk].right ? this->st[kk].right->includes.size[k] : 0;
324  this->includes.size[k] += nr + nl;
325  }
326  }
327  }
328 
329  int
330  size(const int k) const
331  {
332  if constexpr (MAINTAIN_SIZE)
333  {
334  return this->includes.size[k];
335  }
336  else
337  {
338  int s = (k == this->k) ? 1 : 0;
339  for (int kk = 0 ; kk < K ; ++kk)
340  {
341  int nl = this->st[kk].left ? this->st[kk].left->size(k) : 0;
342  int nr = this->st[kk].right ? this->st[kk].right->size(k) : 0;
343  s += nr + nl;
344  }
345  return s;
346  }
347  }
348 
349  inline int
350  size(void) const
351  {
352  int s = 0;
353  for (int k = 0 ; k < K ; ++k)
354  s += this->size(k);
355  return s;
356  }
357 
358  // height
359  inline void
360  update_includes_height(void)
361  requires MAINTAIN_HEIGHT
362  {
363  for (int k = 0 ; k < K ; ++k)
364  {
365  // get left height
366  int hleft, thleft;
367  if (this->st[k].left)
368  {
369  hleft = this->st[k].left->includes.height[k];
370  thleft = this->st[k].left->includes.total_height;
371  }
372  else
373  {
374  hleft = 0;
375  thleft = 0;
376  }
377 
378  // get right height
379  int hright, thright;
380  if (this->st[k].right)
381  {
382  hright = this->st[k].right->includes.height[k];
383  thright = this->st[k].right->includes.total_height;
384  }
385  else
386  {
387  hright = 0;
388  thright = 0;
389  }
390 
391  // get max height
392  this->includes.height[k] = 1 + MAX(hleft, hright);
393  this->includes.total_height = 1 + MAX(thleft, thright);
394  }
395  }
396 
397  int
398  height(int k) const
399  {
400  if constexpr(MAINTAIN_HEIGHT)
401  {
402  return this->includes.height[k];
403  }
404  else
405  {
406  int hleft = this->st[k].left ? this->st[k].left->height(k) : 0;
407  int hright = this->st[k].right ? this->st[k].right->height(k) : 0;
408  return 1 + MAX(hleft, hright);
409  }
410  }
411 
412  inline int
413  height(void) const
414  {
415  if constexpr(MAINTAIN_HEIGHT)
416  {
417  return this->includes.total_height;
418  }
419  else
420  {
421  int thleft = this->st[k].left ? this->st[k].left->height() : 0;
422  int thright = this->st[k].right ? this->st[k].right->height() : 0;
423  return 1 + MAX(thleft, thright);
424  }
425  }
426 
427  inline void
428  update_includes_interval(void)
429  {
430  for (int k = 0 ; k < K ; ++k)
431  {
432  this->includes.hyperrect[k].a = this->hyperrect[k].a;
433  this->includes.hyperrect[k].b = this->hyperrect[k].b;
434 
435  FOREACH_CHILD_BEGIN(this, child, kk, dir)
436  {
437  this->includes.hyperrect[k].a = MIN(
438  this->includes.hyperrect[k].a,
439  child->includes.hyperrect[k].a
440  );
441 
442  this->includes.hyperrect[k].b = MAX(
443  this->includes.hyperrect[k].b,
444  child->includes.hyperrect[k].b
445  );
446  }
447  FOREACH_CHILD_END(this, child, kk, dir);
448  }
449  }
450 
451  virtual inline void
452  update_includes(void)
453  {
454  this->update_includes_interval();
455 
456  if constexpr (MAINTAIN_SIZE)
457  this->update_includes_size();
458 
459  if constexpr (MAINTAIN_HEIGHT)
460  this->update_includes_height();
461  }
462 
463  void
464  dump(FILE * f) const
465  {
466  // dump the node
467  const char * COLORS[] = {
468  "#000000",
469  "#EE3333",
470  "#3333EE",
471  "#33EE33",
472  "#FFFF00",
473  "#FF00FF",
474  "#00FFFF",
475  };
476  const char * color = COLORS[this->colors[this->k] == BLACK ? 0 : this->k+1];
477 
478  // fprintf(f, " N%p[fontcolor=\"#ffffff\", label=\"--- node ---\\n", this);
479  // this->dump_str(f);
480  // fprintf(f, "\", style=filled, fillcolor=\"%s\"] ;\n", color);
481 
482  fprintf(f, " N%p[fontcolor=\"#ffffff\", label=\"", this);
483  this->dump_str(f);
484  fprintf(f, "\", shape=square, style=filled, fillcolor=\"%s\"] ;\n", color);
485 
486  // dump each child
487  for (int k = 0 ; k < K ; ++k)
488  {
489  for (int d = 0 ; d < DIRECTION_MAX ; ++d)
490  {
491  Node * child = reinterpret_cast<Node *>(this->st[k].children[d]);
492  if (child)
493  {
494  child->dump(f);
495  fprintf(f, " N%p->N%p ; \n", this, child);
496  }
497  # if 0
498  else
499  {
500  int idx = 2 * k + d;
501  void * nullnode = ((char *) this) + idx + 1;
502  fprintf(f, " N%p[fontcolor=\"#ffffff\", label=\".\", shape=square, style=filled, fillcolor=\"%s\"] ;\n", nullnode, COLORS[0]);
503  fprintf(f, " N%p->N%p ; \n", this, nullnode);
504  }
505  # endif
506  }
507  }
508  }
509 
510  virtual void
511  dump_str(FILE * f) const
512  {
513  char rect[1024];
514  this->hyperrect.tostring(rect, sizeof(rect));
515 
516  char include_rect[1024];
517  this->includes.hyperrect.tostring(include_rect, sizeof(include_rect));
518 
519  if (K == 2)
520  {
521  fprintf(f, "k=%d\\n%s\\n\\n--- includes ---\\n%s\\nsize=%d\\nheight=%d",
522  this->k,
523  rect,
524  include_rect,
525  this->size(),
526  this->height()
527  );
528  }
529  }
530 
531  void
532  dump_hyperrect(FILE * f) const
533  {
534  assert(K == 1 || K == 2);
535  if (K == 1)
536  {
537  fprintf(f, " \\draw (" INTERVAL_TYPE_MODIFIER ",-" INTERVAL_TYPE_MODIFIER ") rectangle (" INTERVAL_TYPE_MODIFIER ",-" INTERVAL_TYPE_MODIFIER ") node[midway] {[" INTERVAL_TYPE_MODIFIER ".." INTERVAL_TYPE_MODIFIER "[};\n",
538  this->hyperrect[0].a, (INTERVAL_TYPE_T) 0,
539  this->hyperrect[0].b, (INTERVAL_TYPE_T) 2,
540  this->hyperrect[0].a, this->hyperrect[0].b
541  );
542  }
543  else if (K == 2)
544  {
545  fprintf(f, " \\draw [line width=2mm] (" INTERVAL_TYPE_MODIFIER ",-" INTERVAL_TYPE_MODIFIER ") rectangle (" INTERVAL_TYPE_MODIFIER ",-" INTERVAL_TYPE_MODIFIER ") node[midway,scale=10] {",
546  this->hyperrect[1].a, this->hyperrect[0].a,
547  this->hyperrect[1].b, this->hyperrect[0].b
548  );
549  this->dump_hyperrect_str(f);
550  fprintf(f, "};\n");
551  }
552 
553  FOREACH_CHILD_BEGIN(this, child, k, dir)
554  {
555  child->dump_hyperrect(f);
556  }
557  FOREACH_CHILD_END(this, child, k, dir);
558  }
559 
560  virtual void
561  dump_hyperrect_str(FILE * f) const
562  {
563  fprintf(f, "[" INTERVAL_TYPE_MODIFIER ".." INTERVAL_TYPE_MODIFIER "[ x [" INTERVAL_TYPE_MODIFIER ".." INTERVAL_TYPE_MODIFIER "[",
564  this->hyperrect[0].a, this->hyperrect[0].b,
565  this->hyperrect[1].a, this->hyperrect[1].b
566  );
567  }
568 
569  }; /* class Node */
570 
571  /* class tree */
572  public:
573 
574  /* Root node */
575  Node * root;
576 
577  private:
578 
579  /* List of cut-out branches whose subtree requires deletion from memory */
580  std::vector<Node *> limbs;
581 
582  public:
583  KHPTree() :
584  root(nullptr),
585  limbs()
586  {}
587 
588  inline void
589  subtree_delete(Node * node)
590  {
591  if (node == nullptr)
592  return ;
593 
594  FOREACH_CHILD_BEGIN(node, child, k, dir)
595  {
596  subtree_delete(child);
597  }
598  FOREACH_CHILD_END(node, child, k, dir);
599 
600  delete node;
601  }
602 
603  inline void
604  cut(Node * node)
605  {
606  this->limbs.push_back(node);
607  }
608 
609  inline void
610  cut(Node * parent, int k, int dir)
611  {
612  this->cut(parent->st[k].children[dir]);
613  parent->st[k].children[dir] = nullptr;
614  }
615 
616  inline void
617  garbage_collector_run(void)
618  {
619  for (Node * & node : this->limbs)
620  subtree_delete(node);
621  this->limbs.clear();
622  }
623 
624  virtual ~KHPTree()
625  {
626  subtree_delete(this->root);
627  this->garbage_collector_run();
628  }
629 
631  // UTILS //
633  template <typename N>
634  void
635  foreach_k_child(
636  N * root,
637  int k,
638  std::function<void(N *)> f
639  ) {
640  static_assert(std::is_base_of<Node, N>::value);
641 
642  for (int i = 0 ; i < 2 ; ++i)
643  {
644  N * child = reinterpret_cast<N *>(root->st[k].children[i]);
645  if (child)
646  {
647  f(child);
648  foreach_k_child(child, k, f);
649  }
650  }
651  }
652 
653  void
654  foreach_node(
655  Node * root,
656  std::function<void(Node *, void *)> f,
657  void * args
658  ) const {
659  f(root, args);
660  FOREACH_CHILD_BEGIN(root, child, k, dir)
661  {
662  foreach_node(child, f, args);
663  }
664  FOREACH_CHILD_END(root, child, k, dir);
665  }
666 
667  void
668  foreach_node(
669  std::function<void(Node *, void *)> f,
670  void * args
671  ) {
672  this->foreach_node(this->root, f, args);
673  }
674 
675  void
676  foreach_node_until(
677  Node * root,
678  std::function<void(Node *, void *, bool &)> f,
679  void * args,
680  bool & stop
681  ) const {
682  f(root, args, stop);
683  if (stop) return ;
684  FOREACH_CHILD_BEGIN(root, child, k, dir)
685  {
686  foreach_node_until(child, f, args, stop);
687  if (stop) return ;
688  }
689  FOREACH_CHILD_END(root, child, k, dir);
690  }
691 
692  void
693  foreach_node_until(
694  std::function<void(Node *, void *, bool &)> f,
695  void * args
696  ) {
697  bool stop = false;
698  this->foreach_node_until(this->root, f, args, stop);
699  }
700 
701  int
702  height(void) const
703  {
704  return (this->root ? this->root->height() : 0);
705  }
706 
707  int
708  size(void) const
709  {
710  return this->root ? this->root->size() : 0;
711  }
712 
713  void
714  export_pdf(const char * label) const
715  {
716  char filename[512];
717 
718  snprintf(filename, sizeof(filename), "%s-tree.dot", label);
719  FILE * file = fopen(filename, "w");
720  this->dump(file);
721  fclose(file);
722 
723  snprintf(filename, sizeof(filename),
724  "dot -Tpdf -Gdpi=600 %s-tree.dot > %s-tree.pdf",
725  label, label
726  );
727  int r = system(filename);
728  if (r)
729  fprintf(stderr, "dot failed\n");
730 
731  snprintf(filename, sizeof(filename), "%s-rect.tex", label);
732  file = fopen(filename, "w");
733  this->dump_hyperrect(file);
734  fclose(file);
735 
736  snprintf(filename, sizeof(filename),
737  "pdflatex -interaction=nonstopmode %s-rect.tex > /dev/null 2>&1",
738  label
739  );
740  r = system(filename);
741  if (r)
742  fprintf(stderr, "failed: `%s`\n", filename);
743  }
744 
746  // INTERSECT //
748  inline void
749  intersect_from(
750  T & t,
751  const Hyperrect & h,
752  Node * node
753  ) const {
754 
755  if (node == nullptr || !h.intersects(node->includes.hyperrect))
756  return ;
757 
758  if (this->intersect_stop_test(node, t, h))
759  return ;
760 
761  FOREACH_CHILD_BEGIN(node, child, k, dir)
762  {
763  this->intersect_from(t, h, child);
764  }
765  FOREACH_CHILD_END(node, child, k, dir);
766 
767  // in-order traversal
768  if (h.intersects(node->hyperrect))
769  this->on_intersect(node, t, h);
770  }
771 
772  inline void
773  intersect(
774  T & t,
775  const Hyperrect & h
776  ) const {
777  if (h.is_empty())
778  return ;
779  this->intersect_from(t, h, this->root);
780  }
781 
783  // INSERT //
785 
786  // redundant updates
787  void
788  update(Node * node)
789  {
790  while (1)
791  {
792  node->update_includes();
793  if (node->parent)
794  node = node->parent;
795  else
796  break ;
797  }
798  }
799 
807  void
808  rotate_left(Node * A, int k)
809  {
810  tassert(A->st[k].right);
811 
812  // Node * B = A->st[k].left;
813  Node * C = A->st[k].right;
814  Node * D = C->st[k].left;
815  // Node * E = C->st[k].right;
816 
817 // printf("rl(%d, %d, %d, %d, %d)\n", A->parent ? A->parent->k : -1, A->k, C->k, D ? D->k : -1, k);
818 
819  C->st[k].left = A;
820  // C->right = E;
821  // A->left = B;
822  A->st[k].right = D;
823 
824  C->parent = A->parent;
825  if (A->parent == nullptr)
826  this->root = C;
827  else if (A->parent->st[k].left == A)
828  A->parent->st[k].left = C;
829  else
830  A->parent->st[k].right = C;
831 
832  // B->parent = A;
833  A->parent = C;
834  if (D)
835  D->parent = A;
836  // E->parent = C;
837 
838  // B->update_includes();
839  // D->update_includes();
840  // E->update_includes();
841  A->update_includes();
842  C->update_includes();
843  }
844 
845 
853  void
854  rotate_right(Node * A, int k)
855  {
856  Node * B = A->st[k].left;
857  // Node * C = A->st[k].right;
858  // Node * D = B->st[k].left;
859  Node * E = B->st[k].right;
860 
861 // printf("rr(%d, %d, %d, %d, %d)\n", A->parent ? A->parent->k : -1, A->k, B->k, E ? E->k : -1, k);
862 
863  // UPDATE LINKS
864 
865  // B->st[k].left = D;
866  B->st[k].right = A;
867  A->st[k].left = E;
868  // A->st[k].right = C;
869 
870  B->parent = A->parent;
871  if (A->parent == nullptr)
872  this->root = B;
873  else if (A->parent->st[k].left == A)
874  A->parent->st[k].left = B;
875  else
876  A->parent->st[k].right = B;
877 
878  if (E)
879  E->parent = A;
880  // C->parent = A;
881  A->parent = B;
882  // D->parent = B;
883 
884  // E->update_includes();
885  // C->update_includes();
886  // D->update_includes();
887  A->update_includes();
888  B->update_includes();
889  }
890 
891  inline void
892  balance_fixup(int k, Node * z)
893  {
894  tassert(z->colors[k] == RED);
895 
896  // Traditional red-black tree balancing...
897  while (z->parent && z->parent->colors[k] == RED)
898  {
899  // .. but stopping on the k-root
900  if (z->parent->parent && z->parent->parent->k < k)
901  {
902  tassert(z->colors[k] == RED);
903  tassert(z->parent->colors[k] == RED);
904  z->parent->colors[k] = BLACK;
905  break ;
906  }
907 
908  if (z->parent == z->parent->parent->st[k].left)
909  {
910  Node * y = z->parent->parent->st[k].right;
911  if (y && y->colors[k] == RED)
912  {
913  z->parent->colors[k] = BLACK;
914  y->colors[k] = BLACK;
915  z->parent->parent->colors[k] = RED;
916  z = z->parent->parent;
917  }
918  else
919  {
920  if (z == z->parent->st[k].right)
921  {
922  z = z->parent;
923  this->rotate_left(z, k);
924  }
925  z->parent->colors[k] = BLACK;
926  z->parent->parent->colors[k] = RED;
927  this->rotate_right(z->parent->parent, k);
928  }
929  }
930  else
931  {
932  Node * y = z->parent->parent->st[k].left;
933 
934  if (y && y->colors[k] == RED)
935  {
936  z->parent->colors[k] = BLACK;
937  y->colors[k] = BLACK;
938  z->parent->parent->colors[k] = RED;
939  z = z->parent->parent;
940  }
941  else
942  {
943  if (z == z->parent->st[k].left)
944  {
945  z = z->parent;
946  this->rotate_right(z, k);
947  }
948  z->parent->colors[k] = BLACK;
949  z->parent->parent->colors[k] = RED;
950  this->rotate_left(z->parent->parent, k);
951  }
952  }
953  }
954  this->root->colors[k] = BLACK;
955  }
956 
957  inline void
958  insert_finalize(
959  Node * node,
960  T & t
961  ) {
962  this->on_insert(node, t);
963  this->update(node);
964  }
965 
966  inline void
967  insert_fixup(
968  T & t,
969  const Hyperrect & h,
970  Node * parent,
971  int k,
972  Direction dir,
973  const Node * inherit
974  ) {
975  Node * node;
976  if (inherit)
977  node = this->new_node(t, h, k, RED, inherit);
978  else
979  node = this->new_node(t, h, k, RED);
980  tassert(node);
981 
982  parent->st[k].children[dir] = node;
983  node->parent = parent;
984 
985  // inserting a new k-subtree, this k-root is black
986  if (parent->k < k)
987  node->colors[k] = BLACK;
988  // rebalance the k-subtree
989  else
990  this->balance_fixup(k, node);
991 
992  this->insert_finalize(node, t);
993  }
994 
995  static inline void
996  compress(Node * root, int k, int m)
997  {
998  Node * tmp = root->st[k].right;
999 
1000  for (int i = 0; i < m ; ++i)
1001  {
1002  Node * oldtmp = tmp;
1003  tmp = tmp->st[k].right;
1004  root->st[k].right = tmp;
1005  oldtmp->st[k].right = tmp->st[k].left;
1006  tmp->st[k].left = oldtmp;
1007  root = tmp;
1008  tmp = tmp->st[k].right;
1009  }
1010  }
1011 
1012  static inline int
1013  vine_to_rbtree(Node * root, int k, int n)
1014  {
1015  int h = khp_log2(n + 1);
1016  int m = khp_twopow(h) - 1;
1017 
1018  compress(root, k, n - m);
1019 
1020  for (m = m / 2; m > 0; m /= 2)
1021  compress(root, k, m);
1022 
1023  return h;
1024  }
1025 
1026  static void
1027  rbtree_to_vine(Node * root, int k)
1028  {
1029  Node * tmp = root->st[k].right;
1030 
1031  while (tmp)
1032  {
1033  if (tmp->st[k].left)
1034  {
1035  Node * oldtmp = tmp;
1036  tmp = tmp->st[k].left;
1037  oldtmp->st[k].left = tmp->st[k].right;
1038  tmp->st[k].right = oldtmp;
1039  root->st[k].right = tmp;
1040  }
1041  else
1042  {
1043  root = tmp;
1044  tmp = tmp->st[k].right;
1045  }
1046  }
1047  }
1048 
1049  // fixup the tree that just got rebalanced
1050  static inline void
1051  rebalance_fixup(Node * parent, Node * node, int k, int depth, int height)
1052  {
1053  if (node == nullptr)
1054  return ;
1055 
1056  rebalance_fixup(node, node->st[k].left, k, depth + 1, height);
1057  rebalance_fixup(node, node->st[k].right, k, depth + 1, height);
1058 
1059  node->parent = parent;
1060  node->colors[k] = (height == depth) ? RED : BLACK;
1061  node->update_includes();
1062  }
1063 
1064  // rebalance the k-subtree using a Day-Stout-Warren algorithm
1065  inline void
1066  rebalance(Node * root, int k)
1067  {
1068  printf("Rebalancing for k=%d\n", k);
1069  tassert(k == 0 && K == 0 && "Not implemented when K>1");
1070 
1071  Node pseudo_root;
1072  pseudo_root.st[k].right = root;
1073 
1074  rbtree_to_vine(&pseudo_root, k);
1075  int height = vine_to_rbtree(&pseudo_root, k, root->size(k));
1076 
1077  // fixup the tree
1078  Node * new_root = pseudo_root.st[k].right;
1079  if (root->parent == nullptr)
1080  this->root = new_root;
1081  else
1082  {
1083  // k > 0 here
1084  tassert(0 && "Not implemented when K>1");
1085  }
1086 
1087  rebalance_fixup(nullptr, new_root, k, 0, height);
1088 
1089 # if KHP_TREE_ENABLE_COHERENCY_CHECKS
1090  this->coherency(root->includes.hyperrect);
1091 # endif /* KHP_TREE_ENABLE_COHERENCY_CHECKS */
1092  }
1093 
1094  inline void
1095  rebalance(Node * root)
1096  {
1097  for (int k = 0 ; k < K ; ++k)
1098  {
1099  if (this->requires_rebalance(root, k))
1100  rebalance(root, k);
1101  }
1102  }
1103 
1104  inline void
1105  rebalance(void)
1106  {
1107  this->garbage_collector_run();
1108  this->rebalance(this->root);
1109  }
1110 
1111  // heuristic to determine whether the tree needs rebalancing
1112  template<int KDIM>
1113  inline int
1114  requires_rebalance(const int size, const int height) const
1115  {
1116  int ideal_height = khp_log2(size + 1);
1117  // return (height >= 8 && height > 2 * KDIM * ideal_height);
1118  return (height > 2 * KDIM * ideal_height);
1119  }
1120 
1121  // if the k-subtree starting at 'root' requires rebalance
1122  inline int
1123  requires_rebalance(Node * root, int k)
1124  {
1125  const int size = root->size(k);
1126  const int height = root->height(k);
1127  return this->requires_rebalance<1>(size, height);
1128  }
1129 
1130  // if the btree at 'root' requires rebalance
1131  inline int
1132  requires_rebalance(Node * root) const
1133  {
1134  const int size = root->size();
1135  const int height = root->height();
1136  return this->requires_rebalance<K>(size, height);
1137  }
1138 
1139  // if 'this' btree requires rebalance
1140  inline bool
1141  requires_rebalance(void) const
1142  {
1143  return this->root && requires_rebalance(this->root);
1144  }
1145 
1146  void
1147  post_insert(const Hyperrect & h)
1148  {
1149  if constexpr(REBALANCE)
1150  if (this->requires_rebalance())
1151  this->rebalance();
1152 
1153 # if KHP_TREE_ENABLE_COHERENCY_CHECKS
1154  this->coherency(h);
1155 # else
1156  (void) h;
1157 # endif /* KHP_TREE_ENABLE_COHERENCY_CHECKS */
1158  }
1159 
1160  inline void
1161  insert_from_cut(
1162  T & t,
1163  const Hyperrect & h,
1164  Node * parent
1165  ) {
1166  FOREACH_CHILD_BEGIN(parent, child, k, dir)
1167  {
1168  this->cut(parent, k, dir);
1169  }
1170  FOREACH_CHILD_END(parent, child, k, dir);
1171 
1172  parent->hyperrect.copy(h);
1173  this->insert_finalize(parent, t);
1174  }
1175 
1176  inline void
1177  insert_from(
1178  T & t,
1179  Hyperrect & h,
1180  Node * parent,
1181  int k,
1182  const Node * inherit
1183  ) {
1184 
1185  while (k < K)
1186  {
1187  # if 0
1188  // quick-way out, if the rect includes all subrect with an
1189  // 'out' access, we can discard all children
1190  if constexpr (CUT_ON_INSERT)
1191  {
1192  if (h.includes(parent->includes.hyperrect, k))
1193  {
1194  // the includes test is accelerated as we know we are
1195  // already matching dimensions <k
1196  if (this->should_cut(t, h, parent, k))
1197  {
1198  // TODO : what if 'node' is not null ? probably want to
1199  // return something to callee for the case (3)
1200  this->insert_from_cut(t, h, parent);
1201  break ;
1202  }
1203  }
1204  }
1205  # endif
1206 
1207  // case (1) J << I
1208  if (h[k].b <= parent->hyperrect[k].a)
1209  {
1210  if (parent->st[k].left == nullptr)
1211  {
1212  this->insert_fixup(t, h, parent, k, LEFT, inherit);
1213  break ;
1214  }
1215  else
1216  parent = parent->get_child(k, LEFT);
1217  }
1218  // case (2) J >> I
1219  else if (h[k].a >= parent->hyperrect[k].b)
1220  {
1221  if (parent->st[k].right == nullptr)
1222  {
1223  this->insert_fixup(t, h, parent, k, RIGHT, inherit);
1224  break ;
1225  }
1226  else
1227  parent = parent->get_child(k, RIGHT);
1228  }
1229  // case (3) J c I (or I == J)
1230  else if (parent->hyperrect[k].a <= h[k].a && h[k].b <= parent->hyperrect[k].b)
1231  {
1232  // I == J
1233  if (h[k].a == parent->hyperrect[k].a && h[k].b == parent->hyperrect[k].b)
1234  {
1235  if (++k == K)
1236  {
1237  this->insert_finalize(parent, t);
1238  break ;
1239  }
1240  }
1241  // J c I
1242  else
1243  {
1244  // assert(K == 1 || K == 2);
1245 
1246  class ReinsertHyperrect {
1247  public:
1248  Hyperrect h;
1249  Node * inherit;
1250  public:
1251  ReinsertHyperrect(const Hyperrect & r, const Interval & interval, int k, Node * i) :
1252  h(r),
1253  inherit(i)
1254  {
1255  h[k] = interval;
1256  inherit = h.intersects(i->hyperrect) ? i : nullptr;
1257  }
1258 
1259  ~ReinsertHyperrect() {}
1260  };
1261 
1262  std::vector<ReinsertHyperrect> to_reinsert;
1263  const Interval intervals[] = {
1264  Interval(parent->hyperrect[k].a, h[k].a),
1265  Interval( h[k].a, h[k].b),
1266  Interval( h[k].b, parent->hyperrect[k].b)
1267  };
1268 
1269  std::function<void(Node *)> f = [this, &f, &intervals, &k, &to_reinsert](Node * node)
1270  {
1271  assert(node->hyperrect[k].includes(intervals[1]));
1272 
1273  // reinsert sides
1274  if (!intervals[0].is_empty())
1275  to_reinsert.push_back(ReinsertHyperrect(node->hyperrect, intervals[0], k, node));
1276  if (!intervals[2].is_empty())
1277  to_reinsert.push_back(ReinsertHyperrect(node->hyperrect, intervals[2], k, node));
1278 
1279  // shrink node
1280  this->on_shrink(node, intervals[1], k);
1281  node->hyperrect[k] = intervals[1];
1282 
1283  // shrink all child
1284  for (int kk = k+1; kk < K ; ++kk)
1285  {
1286  FOREACH_K_CHILD_BEGIN(node, child, kk, dir)
1287  {
1288  f(child);
1289  }
1290  FOREACH_K_CHILD_END(node, child, kk, dir);
1291  }
1292  };
1293 
1294  f(parent);
1295 
1296  assert(inherit == nullptr);
1297  for (ReinsertHyperrect & rr : to_reinsert)
1298  this->insert_from(t, rr.h, this->root, 0, rr.inherit);
1299 
1300  return this->insert_from(t, h, this->root, 0, nullptr);
1301 
1302  } /* I == J || J c I */
1303  }
1304  // case (4) I n J != o is (1) + (2) + (3)
1305  else
1306  {
1307  // [ I ]
1308  // [ J ]
1309  //
1310  // or
1311  //
1312  // [ J ]
1313  // [ I ]
1314  const INTERVAL_TYPE_T a = h[k].a;
1315  const INTERVAL_TYPE_T b = h[k].b;
1316 
1317  // (1)
1318  if (h[k].a < parent->hyperrect[k].a)
1319  {
1320  h[k].b = parent->hyperrect[k].a;
1321  this->insert_from(t, h, this->root, 0, inherit);
1322  h[k].b = b;
1323  }
1324 
1325  // (2)
1326  if (parent->hyperrect[k].b < h[k].b)
1327  {
1328  h[k].a = parent->hyperrect[k].b;
1329  this->insert_from(t, h, this->root, 0, inherit);
1330  h[k].a = a;
1331  }
1332 
1333  // (3)
1334  {
1335  h[k].a = MAX(a, parent->hyperrect[k].a);
1336  h[k].b = MIN(b, parent->hyperrect[k].b);
1337  this->insert_from(t, h, this->root, 0, inherit);
1338  h[k].a = a;
1339  h[k].b = b;
1340  }
1341 
1342  break ;
1343  }
1344  }
1345  }
1346 
1347  inline void
1348  insert(
1349  T & t,
1350  Hyperrect & h
1351  ) {
1352  if (h.is_empty())
1353  return ;
1354 
1355  if (this->root == nullptr)
1356  {
1357  this->root = this->new_node(t, h, 0, BLACK);
1358  this->insert_finalize(this->root, t);
1359  }
1360  else
1361  {
1362  this->insert_from(t, h, this->root, 0, nullptr);
1363  }
1364 
1365  this->post_insert(h);
1366  }
1367 
1368  inline void
1369  clear(void)
1370  {
1371  this->cut(this->root);
1372  this->garbage_collector_run();
1373  this->root = nullptr;
1374  }
1375 
1376  // Dump the tree to the given file
1377  void
1378  dump(FILE * f) const
1379  {
1380  fprintf(f, "digraph g {\n");
1381  if (this->root)
1382  this->root->dump(f);
1383  fprintf(f, "}\n");
1384  }
1385 
1386  // Dump represented hyperrect to the given file
1387  void
1388  dump_hyperrect(FILE * f) const
1389  {
1390  fprintf(f, "\\documentclass[crop,tikz]{standalone}\n");
1391  fprintf(f, "\\usetikzlibrary{shapes.multipart}\n");
1392  fprintf(f, "\\begin{document}\n");
1393  fprintf(f, "\\begin{tikzpicture}[every text node part/.style={align=center}]\n" );
1394 
1395  if constexpr (K == 1 || K == 2)
1396  {
1397  if (this->root)
1398  this->root->dump_hyperrect(f);
1399  }
1400  else
1401  {
1402  fprintf(f, " Output for K=%d is not supported", K);
1403  }
1404 
1405  fprintf(f, " \\end{tikzpicture}\n");
1406  fprintf(f, "\\end{document}\n");
1407  }
1408 
1409 #if KHP_TREE_ENABLE_COHERENCY_CHECKS
1410 
1411  public:
1413  // Coherency checks //
1415  void
1416  coherency_k(Node * node) const
1417  {
1418  // if k < k', then k'-nodes must be children of k-nodes
1419  FOREACH_CHILD_BEGIN(node, child, k, dir)
1420  {
1421  tassert(node->k <= child->k);
1422  tassert(child->k == k);
1423  coherency_k(child);
1424  }
1425  FOREACH_CHILD_END(node, child, k, dir);
1426  }
1427 
1428  void
1429  coherency_single_path_reset(Node * node) const
1430  {
1431  node->checks.id = 0;
1432  FOREACH_CHILD_BEGIN(node, child, k, dir)
1433  {
1434  coherency_single_path_reset(child);
1435  }
1436  FOREACH_CHILD_END(node, child, k, dir);
1437  }
1438 
1439  void
1440  coherency_single_path_set(Node * node) const
1441  {
1442  tassert(node->checks.id == 0);
1443  node->checks.id = 1;
1444  FOREACH_CHILD_BEGIN(node, child, k, dir)
1445  {
1446  coherency_single_path_set(child);
1447  }
1448  FOREACH_CHILD_END(node, child, k, dir);
1449  }
1450 
1451  void
1452  coherency_single_path(Node * node) const
1453  {
1454  // graph must be a tree
1455  coherency_single_path_reset(node);
1456  coherency_single_path_set(node);
1457  }
1458 
1459  void
1460  coherency_hyperrect_includes_check(Node * ref, void * args) const
1461  {
1462  Node * root = (Node *) args;
1463  tassert(root->includes.hyperrect.includes(ref->hyperrect));
1464  }
1465 
1466  void
1467  coherency_hyperrect_includes_foreach(Node * node, void * args) const
1468  {
1469  (void) args;
1470  auto f = std::bind(&KHPTree<K, T>::coherency_hyperrect_includes_check, this, _1, _2);
1471  foreach_node(node, f, node);
1472  }
1473 
1474  void
1475  coherency_hyperrect_includes(Node * root) const
1476  {
1477  auto f = std::bind(&KHPTree<K, T>::coherency_hyperrect_includes_foreach, this, _1, _2);
1478  foreach_node(root, f, root);
1479  }
1480 
1481  void
1482  coherency_hyperrect_disjoint_compare(Node * ref, void * args) const
1483  {
1484  Node * node = (Node *) args;
1485  tassert(node == ref || !node->hyperrect.intersects(ref->hyperrect));
1486  }
1487 
1488  void
1489  coherency_hyperrect_disjoint_for(Node * node, void * args) const
1490  {
1491  Node * root = (Node *) args;
1492  auto f = std::bind(&KHPTree<K, T>::coherency_hyperrect_disjoint_compare, this, _1, _2);
1493  foreach_node(root, f, node);
1494  }
1495 
1496  void
1497  coherency_hyperrect_disjoint(Node * root) const
1498  {
1499  auto f = std::bind(&KHPTree<K, T>::coherency_hyperrect_disjoint_for, this, _1, _2);
1500  foreach_node(root, f, root);
1501  }
1502 
1503  void
1504  coherency_color(Node * node) const
1505  {
1506  FOREACH_CHILD_BEGIN(node, child, k, dir)
1507  {
1508  // a node is black or red
1509  tassert(node->colors[k] == BLACK || node->colors[k] == RED);
1510 
1511  // children of a red nodes are black
1512  if (node->colors[k] == RED)
1513  {
1514  tassert(child->colors[k] == BLACK);
1515  }
1516 
1517  coherency_color(child);
1518  }
1519  FOREACH_CHILD_END(node, child, k, dir);
1520  }
1521 
1522  int
1523  coherency_black_height_k(Node * node, int k) const
1524  {
1525  // when cut is enabled, black_height is not guaranteed
1526  // TODO: is this a problem ?
1527  if constexpr (CUT_ON_INSERT)
1528  return 1;
1529 
1530  if (node == nullptr)
1531  return 1;
1532 
1533  int color = (node->colors[k] == BLACK) ? 1 : 0;
1534  int left_child_height = color + coherency_black_height_k(node->st[k].left, k);
1535  int right_child_height = color + coherency_black_height_k(node->st[k].right, k);
1536  tassert(left_child_height == right_child_height);
1537 
1538  if (k+1 < K)
1539  {
1540  coherency_black_height_k(node->st[k+1].left, k+1);
1541  coherency_black_height_k(node->st[k+1].right, k+1);
1542  }
1543 
1544  return left_child_height;
1545  }
1546 
1547  void
1548  coherency_black_height(Node * node) const
1549  {
1550  coherency_black_height_k(node, 0);
1551  }
1552 
1553  void
1554  coherency_balance(void) const
1555  {
1556  int height = this->height();
1557  int size = this->size();
1558  int ideal_height = khp_log2(size + 1);
1559  if constexpr (CUT_ON_INSERT)
1560  tassert(height < 2 * K * ideal_height || height < 8);
1561  else
1562  tassert(height <= 2 * K * ideal_height);
1563  }
1564 
1565  void
1566  coherency_size(Node * node) const
1567  {
1568  int size[K];
1569  for (int k = 0 ; k < K ; ++k)
1570  size[k] = 0;
1571  size[node->k] = 1;
1572 
1573  for (int k = node->k ; k < K ; ++k)
1574  {
1575  for (int kk = 0 ; kk < K ; ++kk)
1576  {
1577  int nl = node->st[kk].left ? node->st[kk].left->size(k) : 0;
1578  int nr = node->st[kk].right ? node->st[kk].right->size(k) : 0;
1579  size[k] += nr + nl;
1580  }
1581  }
1582 
1583  for (int k = 0 ; k < K ; ++k)
1584  tassert(size[k] == node->size(k));
1585  }
1586 
1587  void
1588  coherency_k_hierarchy(Node * node) const
1589  {
1590  FOREACH_CHILD_BEGIN(node, child, k, dir)
1591  {
1592  tassert(child->k == k);
1593  tassert(node->k <= child->k);
1594  tassert(k == 0 || node->hyperrect[k-1] == child->hyperrect[k-1]);
1595  coherency_k_hierarchy(child);
1596  }
1597  FOREACH_CHILD_END(node, child, k, dir);
1598  }
1599 
1600  void
1601  coherency_from(Node * root) const
1602  {
1603  /* 2. check per-node size */
1604  coherency_size(root);
1605 
1606  /* 3. If a node is red, then both its children are black */
1607  coherency_color(root);
1608 
1609  /* 4. Every path from a node to any of its descbant NULL nodes
1610  * has the same number of black nodes */
1611  coherency_black_height(root);
1612 
1613  /* 5. rect must be disjoint (weak check) */
1614  coherency_hyperrect_disjoint(root);
1615 
1616  /* 6. check includes.hyperrect */
1617  coherency_hyperrect_includes(root);
1618 
1619  /* 7. includeness relationship between nodes dimension */
1620  coherency_k(root);
1621 
1622  /* 8. graph must be a tree (only 1 path from root to each node) */
1623  coherency_single_path(root);
1624 
1625  /* 9. children for a k-tree must have the same k-interval as their parent */
1626  coherency_k_hierarchy(root);
1627  }
1628 
1629  void
1630  coherency_hyperrect_represented_check(Node * node, void * args) const
1631  {
1632  const Hyperrect * rect = (const Hyperrect *) args;
1633  tassert(rect->includes(node->hyperrect) || !rect->intersects(node->hyperrect));
1634  }
1635 
1636  // TODO : this test is incomplete, should test that all nodes union
1637  // also forms the rect
1638  void
1639  coherency_hyperrect_represented(Hyperrect rect)
1640  {
1641  auto f = std::bind(&KHPTree<K, T>::coherency_hyperrect_represented_check, this, _1, _2);
1642  foreach_node(this->root, f, &rect);
1643  }
1644 
1645  int
1646  coherency(const Hyperrect & h)
1647  {
1648  if (this->root)
1649  {
1650  /* 1. The root of the this is always black */
1651  for (int k = 0 ; k < K ; ++k)
1652  tassert(this->root->colors[k] == BLACK);
1653 
1654  /* per-node checks */
1655  this->coherency_from(this->root);
1656 
1657  /* ensure the rect is represented in the tree */
1658  this->coherency_hyperrect_represented(h);
1659 
1660  /* 7. check balance */
1661  this->coherency_balance();
1662  }
1663 
1664  return 1;
1665  }
1666 
1667 #endif /* KHP_TREE_ENABLE_COHERENCY_CHECKS */
1668 
1669  public:
1670 
1672  // ABSTRACT INTERFACES //
1674 
1675  /* called to create a new node with a rect that never appeared before. */
1676  virtual Node *
1677  new_node(
1678  T & t,
1679  const Hyperrect & h,
1680  const int k,
1681  const Color color
1682  ) const = 0;
1683 
1684  /* called to create a new node, that intersect with a previously insert
1685  * node 'inherit' */
1686  virtual Node *
1687  new_node(
1688  T & t,
1689  const Hyperrect & h,
1690  const int k,
1691  const Color color,
1692  const Node * inherit
1693  ) const = 0;
1694 
1695  # if 0
1696  /* called when the node being inserting includes all the descendent tree
1697  * return true if the subtree should be cut, false otherwise (in such
1698  * case, the insertion is propagated to all the subtree */
1699  virtual bool should_cut(T & t, Hyperrect & h, Node * parent, int k) const = 0;
1700  # endif
1701 
1702  /* called whenever this node is added to the tree */
1703  virtual void on_insert(Node * node, T & t) = 0;
1704 
1705  /* called whenever this node is being shrinked on dimension 'k' to 'interval' */
1706  virtual void on_shrink(Node * node, const Interval & interval, int k) = 0;
1707 
1708  /* called to detect whether the intersect on 'rect' should stop on the node 'node' */
1709  virtual bool intersect_stop_test(Node * node, T & t, const Hyperrect & h) const = 0;
1710 
1711  /* called whenever 'node' intersects with 'rect' */
1712  virtual void on_intersect(Node * node, T & t, const Hyperrect & h) const = 0;
1713 };
